bill_title: require the Board of Counselor Examiners to establish a client bill of rights.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the Board of Counselor Examiners to establish a client bill of rights. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Board of Counselor Examiners shall, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, establish the terms and content of a client bill of rights. The bill of rights shall be consistent with existing statutes, administrative rules, and the ethical standards of the American Counseling Association or the American Association of Marriage and Family Therapy. Section 2. Any practitioner of counseling or marriage and family therapy, whether licensed and unlicensed, shall provide each client with notice of the client bill of rights established pursuant to section 1 of this Act. Section 3. This Act does not apply to: (1) Any professional licensed or certified pursuant to Title 36; (2) Members of the clergy who are providing pastoral services as a part of performing and fulfilling their duties and obligations to their congregation; and (3) Attorneys licensed by the Supreme Court of the State of South Dakota. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
